May Day or International Workers' Day is observed on May 1 all over the world today to commemorate the historical struggle and sacrifices of the working people to establish an eight-hour workday. It is a public holiday in almost all the countries of the world.
Since the Industrial Revolution in the 18th and 19th centuries in Europe and the US, the workers in mills and factories had been working a long shift, fourteen or even more hours'a day.
On May 1 st 1^{\text {st }} 1 st in 1886, inspired by the trade unions, half of the workers at the McCormick Harvesting Machine Company in Chicago went on strike demanding an eight-hour workday. Two days later, a workers' rally was held near the McCormick Harvesting Machine Company and about 6000 workers- joined it. The rally was addressed by the labour leaders. They urged the workers to stand together, to go on with their struggle and not to give in to their bosses. At one point of the rally, some strikebreakers started leaving the meeting place. The strikers went down the street to bring them back. Suddenly, about 200 policemen attacked them with clubs and revolvers. One striker was killed instantly, five or six others were seriously wounded and many others were injured.
The events of May 1,1886 are a reminder that workers will continue to be exploited until they stand up and speak out to gain better working conditions, better pay and better lives.

sub_questions.explanation: a) environment/ condition; b) victims; c) unitedly/ jointly; d) strike; e) accepted/ fulfilled/met.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on "Environment Pollution":
a) What is the environmental pollution? b) What are common types of environmental pollution? c) How are men solely responsible for the pollutions? d) What are the impacts of environmental pollutions? e) How can the pollutions be reduced?

sub_questions.explanation:
Pollution refers to the contamination of something that makes it harmful for human health and unsuitable to be used. Water pollution means making water harmful and contaminated by throwing waste, filth, etc. into it. Water is called life as the life of both animals and plants is impossible without water. But it is being polluted day by day for many reasons. The main reason for water pollution is the irresponsibility of human beings. People throw waste into water and pollute it. Ships throw oil, human wastes and other wastes into rivers and sea water which causes water pollution. Farmers use chemical fertilizers and insecticides in their fields that mix up with rainwater and flow down into rivers. and canals and cause water pollution. Besides, some people use insanitary latrines by rivers, canals or
drains which greatly pollute water. By drinking polluted water people become ill. Fishes die in polluted water and even farming becomes impossible in severely polluted water. It is a threat to our natural environment. People can stop water pollution by being of it. Farmers should use natural or green fertilizers in their fields. People should use
sanitary latrines. Ship owners should be careful to build the bottom layer of their ships properly to stop oil sipping. Thus we can save water from pollution.

questions.uddipok:
Read the beginning of a story. Complete it and give a suitable title to it.
Once upon a time there were two brothers whose father had left them but a small fortune. The eldest grew very rich, but at the same time cruel and wicked, whereas there was nowhere a more honest or kinder man than the younger. One day.

sub_questions.explanation:
The Honest Journey and Its Consequence
Once upon a time, there were two brothers whose father had left them but a small fortune. The eldest grew very rich, but at the same time cruel and wicked, whereas there was nowhere a more honest and kinder man than the younger. One day, the younger brother, Alif found himself in a helpless situation when he had neither food nor wood in his house.
He set off in search of food for his wife and children. After walking a long way, Alif witnessed Faruq attacking an old man who had merely asked for help with his heavy bag. Alif immediately stepped in, rescued the old man, and carried the bag for him. On their way, Alif shared how Faruq took away entire of their father's property and made Alif helpless. Being curious about the bag's contents, Alif then asked the old man, "What's there in the bag, uncle?" The old man replied, "I'm going to shift near the forest. So, I'm carrying all my precious things there including gold." Aftet reaching the destination, the old man went inside and returned with food and some gold coins. He presented them to Alif as a token of gratitude. Alif was shocked but accepted the gift humbly. Using the gold, he started providing the necessities of his family.
Noticing Alif's sudden change in fortune, Faruq became suspicious. He hurried to Alif's cottage the next day and threatened him to confess how he had obtained the money. Alif explained the truth about the old mian's gift.
Driven by greed, Faruq decided to go to the old man to claim all the gold for himself. Reaching old man's house, Faruq said, "Give me all your possessions, old weak creature!" The old man got afraid. In a trembling voice, he refused to give anything and tried to get Faruk out of his home. Howeyer, Faruk was so desperate that he went out of his mind and killed the old man to seize the gold. Being able to get all the precious things, Faruq was going back home happily. However, on his way back, a group of robbers noticed Faruq. They killed him and took away his bag containing gold.
Moral: Greed is the root of all evil.

questions.uddipok: The chart below shows the increase of literacy rate of Bangladesh. Describe the chart in 150 words. You should highlight and summarize the information given in the chart.

sub_questions.explanation: The graph deals with the literacy rate of Bangladesh. It shows the trend in literacy rate that took place within the time span of 1995 to 2010 . In the year 1995 , only 38.1 percent people of Bangladesh were literate. The rate took a good leap to 56 percent in 2000, within the period of 5 years. Unfortunately, in 2001, the literacy rate decreased to 47.9 percent. In 2003, the trend of decrease went on, and as a result, the literacy rate went down to 43.1 percent. In 2010, with a happy note, the literacy rate went up to 56.8 percent. It was the result of hard work of the previous seven years. So, it can be said that within the period of 15 years, there is a great achievement in education sector. In this period of time, the literacy rate has increased a lot.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Remel. You are a concerned citizen of the country. N ow write a letter to your friend Robin telling him the devastating effects of drug addiction.

sub_questions.explanation:
Mohammadpur, Dhaka
22 August 2024

Dear Robin,
First and foremost, I have a great affection for you, for what you have been and for what I know you can be. It broke my heart when I learnt that you are suffering from a horrible problem called drug addiction.
Friend, please try to understand one thing: drug addiction will rob you and your family of joy. You will also loose your dignity among your relatives and friends.
Your health is already damaged. You are not regular in classes, and you don't even take part in games and sports anymore. It really hurts to see that one of my best friends is wasting away due to drug addiction. Besides, drug addicts are involved in various 'social crimes like snatching and stealing to collect money for drugs. I can't see you as one of such criminals. I don't understand why you have chosen this path. I just pray to the Almighty that He may bless you and you could give up drug addiction.
No more today. Convey my greetings to your parents. I hope to hear that you've overcome drug addiction. I'll be relieved and happy.

Your friend,
Remel

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Shovon and Shushil is your friend. Now write a dialogue between you and your friend about the progress of your preparation for upcoming SSC examination.

sub_questions.explanation:
About the progress of preparation for the upcoming SSC examination
Shovon : Hey Shushil how's your preparation going for the SSC exam?
Shushil : Hi Shovon! It's going pretty well. I've been following a strict study schedule to cover all the subjects. How about you?
Shovon : Same here. I've divided my time to revise all the topics and set daily goals.
Shushil : It is important to ensure we cover everything in time.
Shovon. : By the way, which subject are you finding the hardest?
Shushil : For me, it's math. Some of the concepts are really tricky. But I've been solving questions from test papers, which has been helpfur. What about you?
Shovon : Chemistry is giving me a tough time. I'm trying to focus more on understanding the concepts rather than just memorizing them.
Shushil : That's a good approach. Take notes while revising. It will help you remeber them.
Shovon : Yeah, my home-tutor also said so.
Shushil : I've been doing the same with math. By the way, have you joined any study groups?
Shovon : Yes, I'm part of a study group with a few friends. It's really helpful to discuss and solve problems together. Are you in any study groups?
Shushil : I am! It's been a great way to clear doubts and share study resources.
Shovon : Besides, it's motivating to study with others. How are you managing stress?
Shushil  : I take regular breaks and try to get enough sleep.
Shovon : Same here. I also do a bit of exercise to stay fresh and focused.
Shushil : That's good. It's important to stay positive.
Shovon : Look, we've prepared well, and I'm sure we'll do great!
Shushil : Absolutely! We just need to stay focused and keep up the hard work.
Shovon : Best of luck with your studies, Shushil!
Shushil : Thanks, Shovon! Best of luck to you too!

questions.uddipok:
Zahir Raihan was one of the most talented filmmakers in Bangladesh. He was born on 19 August 1935 in the village Majupur in Feni district. He was an active worker of the Language Movement. He was one of the ten students to go out in a procession on 21 . February 1952 despite a ban on such activities imposed by the authorities. As a result, he and many others were arrested and taken to prison. Zahir was also present at the historical meeting of Amtala on 21 February 1952. He also took part in the mass movement in 1969. In 1971, he joined the Liberation War.
All through his life, Zahir Raihan dreamt of a democratic society, a society that will ensure freedom of speech and will. He had many dreams about our film industry too. He made a legendary film 'Jibon Theke Neya' based on the Language Movement of 1952. It was a revolt against the autocratic government. The family presented in that film was a miniature East Pakistan ruled by an autocrat who had to go to prison for her conspiracy. During the Liberation War, this film was shown outside Bangladesh. Celebrated filmmakers like Satyajit Ray, Mrinal Sen, and Ritwik Ghatak appreciated the film. Zahir gave all the money to the Freedom Fighters' trust that he get from his film shows. Besides, his great documentary on Pakistani atrocities, 'Stop Genocide', helped create world sentiment in favour of our liberation war.
On 30 December 1971, someone informed Zahir about an address somewhere at Mirpur, where he might find his brother, the famous writer Shahidullah Kaiser. Shahidullah was captured and killed by the Pakistani army and the local collaborators during the last days of the war. Accordingly, Zahir left home to get his brother back but he never returned. Zahir's dream was fulfilled. He could see the inception of a free independent Bangladesh though he did not get back his brother. And it's a pity that this dreamer was missing at such a time when his dream came true.
